scenarioTitle: Not Paid for a Shift as a Student Worker
scenarioDescription: You are a student working part-time and believe you were not paid correctly for work you completed.

q1.question: Did you complete a work shift that was not paid on your payslip?

q2.question: What explanation did your employer give for not paying you?

choices.label: They said it was a trial shift
They said it would be paid later

q3.question: Do you have any written evidence of the shift you worked?

q4.question: Are you worried about losing shifts if you raise this issue?

outcome.question: Thank you. Your answers will allow us to generate a legal summary of your employment rights.

outcome_no_issue.question: Based on your answers, there is no unpaid work issue to report.

legalSummaryText: If you carried out work, you are legally entitled to be paid at least the National Minimum Wage, even if the shift was described as a trial. Zero-hours contracts do not remove your right to pay, and employers cannot lawfully withhold wages or penalise you for raising concerns about unpaid work.

legalSources.sourceDescription: Establishes the right to be paid at least the National Minimum Wage for work performed.

legalSources.sourceTitle: If your employer doesn't pay you
legalSources.sourceDescription: Guidance on what to do if an employer withholds pay.
